keel.Algorithms.Rule_Learning.CN2

Class Complex

  • java.lang.Object
    • keel.Algorithms.Rule_Learning.CN2.Complex
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable

    public class Complex
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable

    Title: Complex

    Description: Structure to represent a complex of one rule

    Since:
    JDK1.5
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Written by José Ramón Cano de Amo (University of Granada) 28/07/2004, Modified by Alberto Fernández (University of Granada) 15/06/2006

        public Complex(Selector sel,
               int nClas)
        Complete builder. It add the number of classes and a selector
        Parameters:
        sel - Selector
        nClas - Number of classes

      • Complex

        public Complex(int atr,
               int op,
               double val)
        Builder. It creates a selector from an attribute,operator value and builds the complex
        Parameters:
        atr - Id of the input attribute
        op - operator code (higher or equal, distinct...)
        val - Attribute value

    • Method Detail

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(java.lang.Object o)
        Comparison function between two objects of the class complex
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable
        Parameters:
        o - "complex" object to compare
        Returns:
        0 if the heuristics are equal. 1 if the current complex has a higher heuristic . -1 if the complex to compare has a higher heuristic

      • same

        public boolean same(Complex c)
        It checks if a complex is equal to another. They must have the same attribute, operator and value.
        Parameters:
        c - Complex to compare
        Returns:
        True if they are the same. False in other case

      • almostSame

        public boolean almostSame(Complex c)
        It checks if a complex is almost the same to another
        Parameters:
        c - Complex to compare
        Returns:
        True if they are the same but the last selector. False in other case

      • sameDistribution

        public boolean sameDistribution(Complex c)
        It checks if two complexes have the same class distribution
        Parameters:
        c - Complex to compare
        Returns:
        boolean True if they have the same class distribution for all classes. False in other case
